prescribed for the purposes of making a claim for entry in the first register of 
electors under section 12 of the Seanad Electoral (University Members) 
(Amendment) Act 2024. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

5 December, 2024. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 6th December, 2024.

Information and Guidance 

Application for entry to the Register for the Higher Education 
Constituency 

This form should be used by eligible persons to submit their claim to be 
entered on the Register of Electors for the Seanad Higher Education 
constituency. The easiest way to register is by completing the application form 
online at www.seanadvoter.ie. 

Eligibility to Register 

Important Dates 

You must be: 

➢ a citizen of Ireland, and 
➢ eighteen years of age or older, and 
➢ have received a degree (other than 
an honorary degree) which is at 
least at bachelor degree level, from 
a designated institution (listed 
overleaf) 

Dates are set out in the Seanad Electoral 
(University Members) (Amendment) Act 
2024: 

➢ Applications for the first register of 
electors must be received by 23 
January 2025. 

➢ Late applications will not be 

considered. 

➢ The first register of electors will be 

published on 1 April 2025. 

The forthcoming Seanad General Election (January 2025) will be held on 
the basis of the existing NUI and University of Dublin (Trinity College) 
constituencies electing three Senators each. Where vacancies occur among 
those elected in accordance with that process, NUI and University of Dublin 
(Trinity College) graduates who are included on the Higher Education 
constituency register will be eligible to vote in ensuing by-elections. This 
arrangement will apply only until any dissolution of the Dáil after 21 March 
2025, from which point the Higher Education constituency will elect all six 
Senators. 

The first register of electors for the new constituency will be published on 1 April 
2025 and will be in force until the first annual revision is complete. A revised 
register will be published on 1 June 2026 and every 1 June thereafter. 

More information is available on Seanadvoter.ie. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [680] 

Information required 

The legal basis for this form, the information sought therein and how your 
information is used is set out in the Seanad Electoral (University Members) 
(Amendment) Act 2024. This includes provisions to seek some personal data 
including name, address, date of birth, Personal Public Service Number (PPSN) 
and citizenship details. It also sets out the legal basis for sharing data with other 
designated institutions, the Minister for Social Protection and any Minister of 
the Government or specified public body where it is necessary and proportionate, 
including to verify the accuracy of a claim and to identify duplicates. 

The Higher Education constituency is a new constituency. Everyone wishing to 
vote in the Higher Education constituency must first submit a claim (application) 
either online at Seanadvoter.ie or using this form. 

It’s easier online! 
The easiest way to register to vote is online www.seanadvoter.ie 

You can submit this form by post to: 
SeanadVoter.ie 
PO Box 13784 
Dublin 2 
Ireland 

Before sending your paper form, please ensure you: 

➢ Complete sections A and B 
➢ Complete the declaration, section C 
➢ Attach proof of citizenship (if required) 
➢ Attach witness form, section D (if required) 

Completing this form 

Section A: Identity details: All applicants are required to complete Section 
A identity details. Your identity may be checked by the Central Registration 
Authority in line with legislation as referred to above. 

Section B: Qualification details: All applicants are required to complete the 
relevant parts of Section B. This information will be shared for verification 
with the relevant institution. 

Section C: Declaration of Truthfulness: All applicants are required to 
complete the declaration of truthfulness. 

Section D: Witness form if required 

Designated Institutions 

To be eligible to apply, you must have received a degree from a designated institution. 
“Designated institutions” means the National University of Ireland, the University of Dublin 
(Trinity College), and institutions that are designated under the Higher Education Authority 
Act 2022 (listed below). The definition includes institutions that have been dissolved and had 
their functions transferred to a designated institution. For more information, visit 
www.SeanadVoter.ie.

Important 

If you are already on the register for the NUI constituency or the 
University of Dublin (Trinity College) constituency a letter will have issued 
to your address on record in December 2024. If you have received the letter 
you can use the National University of Ireland (NUI) reference number/ TCD 
Alumni number contained therein to assist in completing your claim for 
registration for the new constituency. The NUI reference number/TCD Alumni 
number will be used to check your details. 

For all other applicants the following information is required: 

• 
PPSN or Witness form: Providing your PPSN will enable confirmation 
of your identity details and help to protect the integrity of the register. 
Alternatively, complete Section D - Witness form to confirm your identity. 

• 
Evidence of citizenship: Applicants are asked to provide supporting 
documentation in relation to their citizenship. This may be a photocopy of the 
photo page of your valid Irish Passport or a copy of your Certificate of 
Naturalisation.

Section D - Seanad Éireann Electoral Registration Witness Form 

If you have not provided a PPSN or an NUI reference number/TCD Alumni 
number in your claim form, take this form and your photographic identification 
(ID) to your local Garda station or any Notary/Notary Public to confirm your 
identity. If they are satisfied as to your identification, they will witness you 
signing this form, and then proceed to sign, date, and stamp the form. If you are 
unable to attend your local Garda station or a Notary/Notary Public due to illness 
or disability, you must have your form endorsed by a registered medical 
practitioner in the same manner.
